title: Evaluating functions
text: Given the equation for a function, we should replace the input variable in the equation with the value provided and then calculate the result.
speech: Given the equation for a function, we should replace the input variable in the equation with the value provided and then calculate the result.
pacedSpeech: Given the equation for a function, we should replace the input variable in the equation with the value provided and then calculate the result.

title: Replacement
text: Replace the variable $$x$$ with -a, and we get $$f(-a)=-5{\left(-a\right)}^2+2\left(-a\right)-1$$.
speech: Replace the variable  x  with -a, and we get  f of negative a is equal to negative 5 times, parentheses negative a  squared plus 2 times negative a, minus 1 .
pacedSpeech: with -a, and we get   f of negative a is equal to negative 5 times,  negative a  squared plus 2 times negative a, minus 1

title: Simplification
text: Simplify the expression $$-5{\left(-a\right)}^2+2\left(-a\right)-1$$. What do you get?
speech: Simplify the expression  minus, 5 times, parentheses negative a  squared plus 2 times negative a, minus 1 . What do you get?
pacedSpeech: Simplify the expression   minus, 5 times,  negative a  squared plus 2 times negative a, minus 1
